meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be ill or injured in order to avoid work or duty.
meanings.sent1: The teacher suspected that the student was one of the malingerers in the class.
meanings.sent2: The hospital staff were tired of dealing with malingerers who faked their symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The group of malingerers tried to skip their chores by pretending to have a mysterious illness.
meanings.sent4: The detective uncovered the truth about the malingerers who were avoiding their responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the character was portrayed as a clever malingerer who fooled everyone with fake injuries.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be ill or injured in order to avoid work or duty.
meanings.sent1: Some employees may malinger to get out of doing their tasks.
meanings.sent2: He decided to malinger and stay home from work by pretending to have a fever.
meanings.sent3: The children thought it would be fun to malinger and play hooky from school.
meanings.sent4: She didn't want to attend the meeting, so she chose to malinger with a fake cough.
meanings.sent5: The soldier was caught trying to malinger his way out of the difficult mission.
